newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch De Boer Unigro member of Superunie.
newsitem.headline: Dutch De Boer Unigro member of Superunie.

text.p: De Boer Unigro, the supermarket combine of De Boer Winkelbedrijven NV and Unigro, has become a member of purchasing group Superunie, both companies said on Friday.
They said the new combine had become a Superunie member as of January 1 this year, with membership being sealed once the merger between the two supermarket chains was final.
"The membership will take effect as soon as the merger has been formally finalised," the two said in a joint statement.
De Boer has been a member of Superunie for several years, whereas Unigro mostly purchased independently.
Including De Boer Unigro, Superunie will represent a consumer turnover of 13 billion guilders, becoming the biggest Dutch purchasing combine with a market share of 30 percent, the statement said.
Both chains announced their intention to merge in October last year.
The merger will create the second-largest player in the Dutch retail grocery sector with a 13 percent market share.
Total sales will amount to over six billion guilders on an annual basis in the Netherlands, Belgium and Spain.
